title: HTML File Paths
gp1: A file path describes the location of a file in a web site's folder structure.
gp2: A file path describes the location of a file in a web site's folder structure.
gp3: File paths are used when linking to external files
gp4: An absolute file path is the full URL to a file:
wp1: A relative file path points to a file relative to the current page.
wp2: In the following example, the file path points to a file in the images folder located at the root of the current web:
wp3: In the following example, the file path points to a file in the images folder located in the current folder:
wp4: In the following example, the file path points to a file in the images folder located in the folder one level up from the current folder:
wp5: When using relative file paths, your web pages will not be bound to your current base URL. All links will work on your own computer (localhost) as well as on your current public domain and your future public domains.
